title: WebsiteAvid
author: WebsiteAvid
content: Hey folks!I'm currently buying empty eth walletsWallets must be at least 6+ months old with activityAll you need to do is message me your address and I'll send over an offerPaying $5-10 depending on how active the address isCan pay with cryptoI'll send money first for reputable membersContact me on Skype: https://join.skype.com/invite/oA0wTMZXRah0

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: My question is why do you wanna buy old wallet with activity?To me there is no business without a profit so could you explain bit why you are buying all this old wallet.Anyway I am not interested of selling any but just curious to know the reason you needed to those old eth address.

comments.author: WebsiteAvid
comments.body: Hey! - Totally understandableBasically I want to participate in new incentivised testnets and they tend to reject wallets that are pretty recent as they think you might be a bot.Which is why I'm looking for old wallets preferably with activityHope that clears things up

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: WebsiteAvid on February 22, 2023, 08:53:32 PMHey! - Totally understandableBasically I want to participate in new incentivised testnets and they tend to reject wallets that are pretty recent as they think you might be a bot.Which is why I'm looking for old wallets preferably with activityHope that clears things up  Selling of wallet really don't seem possible to me since even after the deal is done there is no full assurance of ownership transfer, the original owner can't always be keeping track of the wallet and might be tempted to move out your proposed funds which might be gotten from your said testnet

comments.author: WebsiteAvid
comments.body: The testnets I want to do, you deposit crypto on their platform and the wallet is just used to sign messages and approve transactions so it's not a huge risk for me

comments.author: ONCF
comments.body: Quote from: WebsiteAvid on February 22, 2023, 08:20:12 PMHey folks!I'm currently buying empty eth walletsWallets must be at least 6+ months old with activityAll you need to do is message me your address and I'll send over an offerPaying $5-10 depending on how active the address isCan pay with cryptoI'll send money first for reputable membersContact me on Skype: https://join.skype.com/invite/oA0wTMZXRah0I haven't logged in to the forum for a long time, and today it was the first time I dealt with this person @WebsiteAvid. I sold him my old Ethereum wallet, and he paid me $12 of BNB for it, smooth and fast transaction. Thank you bro

comments.author: shoreno
comments.body: sold my old eth addy. legit!

comments.author: Usdt2023
comments.body: I sold him  a wallet he pay instantly thanks my  friend

comments.author: WebsiteAvid
comments.body: Paying the MAX for wallets with DEX activity! Preferably Uniswap transactions before 2021

comments.author: klarki
comments.body: What is the maximum number of wallets you can buy?

comments.author: WebsiteAvid
comments.body: Buying as much as you can get, as long as they have uniswap activity before 2021!

comments.author: klarki
comments.body: Quote from: WebsiteAvid on February 24, 2023, 10:34:28 PMBuying as much as you can get, as long as they have uniswap activity before 2021! I can supply you with over 1,000 wallets. That's why I'm asking if you're ready to handle this volume.

comments.author: WebsiteAvid
comments.body: For sure. Add me on skype

comments.author: chinesetranslator
comments.body: still buying? i have some address

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: OP's explanation on why they needed active ETH wallets sounded plausible. However, those selling should also factor in certain risk associated with such. For instance, I hope they don't get tagged as farmed accounts as alts with others here too. Many users were caught unawares like that in the past because they sold bounties to same users and their wallets got connected. I'm not saying that's exactly what's going to happen here. Just stating my perspective and one cent opinion.

comments.author: WebsiteAvid
comments.body: Paying $15 for wallets with uniswap transactions before 09-2020

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: Quote from: WebsiteAvid on February 25, 2023, 08:34:16 PMPaying $15 for wallets with uniswap transactions before 09-2020  I can't help but wonder if you are wanting to cash in on a fork that occurred around that time that most people are probably oblivious to?  Not saying there actually was a fork, but I'm wondering.

comments.author: darkangel11
comments.body: Quote from: Timelord2067 on February 26, 2023, 10:40:46 AMQuote from: WebsiteAvid on February 25, 2023, 08:34:16 PMPaying $15 for wallets with uniswap transactions before 09-2020  I can't help but wonder if you are wanting to cash in on a fork that occurred around that time that most people are probably oblivious to?  Not saying there actually was a fork, but I'm wondering.There was nothing in the ETH itself, apart from the POW-POS fork in 9.2020, but ther could be an altcoin distribution that required used ETH address, the way MWC coin required you to input BTC address to be eligible. If OP found some smart way to capitalize on old addresses, good for him.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: WebsiteAvid on February 25, 2023, 08:34:16 PMPaying $15 for wallets with uniswap transactions before 09-2020  There's a risk involved on it because the seller we cannot call it a seller because they still have a copy of the private keys, the right word is sharer, and they can also participate in these tenets and beat you to claim the airdrop, but anyway since you seem to be comfortable with that risk and paying to pay people to share their wallet, it's your decision to take that risk.

comments.author: dragonvslinux
comments.body: Quote from: darkangel11 on February 26, 2023, 11:16:04 AMQuote from: Timelord2067 on February 26, 2023, 10:40:46 AMQuote from: WebsiteAvid on February 25, 2023, 08:34:16 PMPaying $15 for wallets with uniswap transactions before 09-2020  I can't help but wonder if you are wanting to cash in on a fork that occurred around that time that most people are probably oblivious to?  Not saying there actually was a fork, but I'm wondering.There was nothing in the ETH itself, apart from the POW-POS fork in 9.2020, but ther could be an altcoin distribution that required used ETH address, the way MWC coin required you to input BTC address to be eligible. If OP found some smart way to capitalize on old addresses, good for him.From a quick search I also found also PulseChain and Etherlite. Couldn't find a coin price on the former and the latter was 10-15 ETL per ETH at a value of $0.000464, so I'm guessing this is about ETHPOW.
